title: Music Theory Terms
description: Explore musical notation and theory terminology in this educational quiz

questions.question: What does 'tempo' refer to in music?
options: The speed or pace at which a piece of music is played

questions.question: In music theory, what is an 'octave'?
options: The interval between one musical pitch and another with double its frequency

questions.question: What does 'allegro' indicate in a musical score?
In music, what is a 'chord'?
options: Three or more notes sounded together in harmony

questions.question: In music theory, what is a 'key signature'?
options: The key to the music room
The set of sharps or flats at the beginning of a staff indicating the key
The final note of a song

questions.question: What does 'staccato' mean in musical performance?
What is a 'fermata' in music notation?
options: A symbol indicating a note should be held longer than its normal value

questions.question: What is 'syncopation' in music?
options: A rhythm that places emphasis on normally weak beats or off-beats

questions.question: What does 'legato' mean in musical terms?
options: Smooth and connected, with no gaps between notes

questions.question: In music theory, what is a 'time signature'?
options: A notation indicating the number of beats per measure and the note value of one beat
The year a piece was composed
